Package it.polimi.ingsw.server

Class Server

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
The Server class manages the server-side network infrastructure, accepting new connections. In addition, it takes care of multi-lobby management and user registration. This class implements a Singleton pattern
See Also:
Runnable

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int PORT
    Port number on which the server is waiting for new connections

    • PORT

      public static final int PORT
      Port number on which the server is waiting for new connections
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Server getInstance()
      Always returns the same instance of the server, the class implements the singleton pattern
      Returns:
      The server instance, null if there was a problem creating the instance

    • thereIsAOpenLobby

      boolean thereIsAOpenLobby()

    • insertIntoLobby

      void insertIntoLobby​(java.lang.String name, ClientConnection clientConnection, java.io.ObjectInputStream in) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      Used to insert a new player just logged into an already open lobby.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player
      clientConnection - The clientConnection of the player that is used to communicate with the client
      in - The objectInputStream of the player's socket
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem with the ObjectInputStream object
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown if the object received on the inputStream is not recognized

    • createNewLobby

      void createNewLobby​(ClientConnection clientConnection, java.lang.String name, java.io.ObjectInputStream in) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      Method used to create a new lobby on the server. Communicate directly with the client about the size of the lobby. The client that created the lobby is automatically inserted into the newly created lobby.
      Parameters:
      clientConnection - The clientConnection of the player that is used to communicate with the client
      name - The name of the player
      in - The objectInputStream of the player's socket
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem with the ObjectInputStream object
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown if the object received on the inputStream is not recognized
      See Also:
      Lobby

    • addRegisteredUsers

      boolean addRegisteredUsers​(java.lang.String username)
      Used to register a new player on the server
      Parameters:
      username - The new username
      Returns:
      Returns true if the registration is successful otherwise false
      See Also:
      Lobby

    • unregisteredUsername

      void unregisteredUsername​(java.lang.String username)
      Used to unregister a player
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username
      See Also:
      Player

    • findLobby

      Lobby findLobby​(java.lang.String username)
      Used to find a lobby based on a player's name.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      Returns:
      Returns the lobby instance containing the player or null if no match was found.
      See Also:
      Lobby, Player

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer​(java.lang.String username)
      Method used to remove a player. If the player has been assigned to a lobby, it is closed and all players assigned to it are removed.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username
      See Also:
      Lobby, Player

    • closeLobby

      public void closeLobby​(Lobby lobby)
      Method used to close and remove a lobby from the server.
      Parameters:
      lobby - The instance of the lobby
      See Also:
      Lobby

    • run

      public void run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
